column1: A 3D printing platform that helps business owners create 3D-printed products
The startup is building a digital platform to enable farmers to monitor and manage the health of their crops.
A platform that helps people easily sell used furniture, household goods, and other items.
A platform that allows people to create online courses. Currently, it has over 60,000 registered users and 10,000 courses created.
A platform for hiring people, and for the employers to find them.
A platform that pairs people who have a spare room in their home with those who need a place to stay.
Idea: A platform for connecting students with mentors from the world's top universities
A platform that helps people find jobs at other companies, allowing them to rate employers and allow their profiles to be searched by employers.
A startup offers a platform for small businesses to rent private offices and conference rooms to employees who work remotely.
A platform to help people find the best care for the elderly, with a focus on home healthcare.
A platform that offers a variety of content for moms and babies, from playlists to educational videos.
This startup is building a mobile app that delivers on-demand cleaning services to customers via the app. It comes with a mobile phone app and an autonomous robot that supports the platform.
A platform that helps employers manage remote workers. It also provides HR services.
A platform to help small businesses build their own credit scoring and risk assessment models.

A startup for selling and buying used computers from other people. Users can sell their old computers in exchange for cash or trade them in for newer ones. The company provides a platform to help people sell their old computers and also offers a buy credit option.
A high-tech restaurant platform that tracks how food is being served and how it is being prepared in real-time.
A platform for helping consumers shop for and price items
A customer service platform for small businesses that wants to be a sort of virtual assistant.
Building a platform for independent artists to distribute music and merchandise.
A small business loan platform for companies like hair salons, construction companies, etc. that want to use their own credit check data to verify their customers’ ability to pay back loans.
A female-focused, non-sexualized virtual reality platform where women can connect with other women in a safe and judgement-free environment to discuss and learn about sexual health and wellness.
A machine-learning based platform that can predict the likelihood of you turning into a customer by looking at your behavior on other sites.

A platform that connects customers to doctors and patients in a way that doesn’t require uploading even a single file. Patients can ask any doctor questions about anything, and get a personalized response in a few minutes.

A startup that wants to sell insurance to people who own property, and who want to protect it in the event of a fire. The startup has already built a platform for homeowners to claim their coverage, but needs to raise $5 million to build out a back-end system and additional products.
An online video platform that allows users to create interactive videos that are then shared on Facebook.
A fintech startup that is building a platform that will let users import financial data from different platforms and create a financial dashboard that can be integrated with other platforms.
A platform designed to help people and companies save and invest together.
A platform from Tel Aviv, Israel, that compares the cost and quality of products you’re buying to help you make smarter decisions.
A startup that provides a platform for the open exchange of knowledge about finance, investing, and managing money.
A platform that lets users have one app to manage all of their financial accounts.
A platform for the healthcare industry, offering a way for patients to get a diagnosis and treatment based on their symptoms.

A digital platform for automated room service ordering in hotels. Users can order from a menu of the hotel’s dishes, and the order is sent to the kitchen directly. The startup is working with a dozen hotels in India.
A mobile payments platform for ride sharing, carpooling, and taxi services.

A platform that helps designers collaborate on projects and publish their work online. The startup is currently in a beta phase, and has built a large audience that has helped it refine its design process.
A real estate financing platform that connects investors with borrowers and saves them time and money.
A platform that helps people share what they are working on in a more elegant way.
A platform that helps companies analyze their own data, with a focus on finding ways to make information more actionable.
The company offers a platform where you can order and deliver a meal from a restaurant you’ve never heard of before.
A social platform for people to connect with local businesses. The app works as a “local discovery app” that helps people discover places to eat and shop, and connects them with local businesses.
A platform that helps people find the best places to hang out at night, like bars and music venues.
This startup is building a mobile platform for legal documents, allowing people to register a document and upload it, then send it to an attorney or various companies to have it reviewed.
An online platform that helps individuals design and sell products made of wood.
A platform for scientists to share and discover data.

A startup that’s building a crowdfunding platform for entrepreneurs. The company is working with the Stars Foundation, which helps invest in startups in developing countries, to create an online platform to help entrepreneurs raise funds.
A platform that helps people find out if a restaurant is halal, or if it’s clean and healthy.
A startup that is building a platform for companies to better communicate with their customers
A startup that provides a platform for managing and connecting third-party software for mobile devices The company says it has $10,000 in monthly recurring revenue, mainly from Android
Idea: A remote workforce management platform
A digital platform for mortgage brokers to help them manage their portfolios.
A platform for “pay-at-the-table” service restaurants.
A platform that allows brands to build mobile apps for their business and for consumers to find them.
A platform to help parents monitor, track, and control the online activities of their children.
This startup wants to build a tool that allows users to direct all of their social media traffic to a single platform, cutting down on the time it takes to manage multiple accounts.
Imagine an app that tells you when all of your favorite brands are offering some new deal. With their tech platform, the company is building a business that runs “brand-specific loyalty programs.”
A software platform for real estate agents that allows agents to manage their relationships with their clients, and track and analyze the leads generated.
A social platform that allows people to discover new places to eat and drink and people to discover new places to eat and drink.

A startup that wants to make it easier for companies to manage data and systems, similar to Zenoss. They’re looking to build a platform for teams to monitor and manage their servers in a single platform.
A digital platform for the creative community. It is a marketplace that connects creative talent with needs-based projects.
A platform for young adults to take a break from college and earn money.
A health care platform that aims to help doctors communicate with patients and their families in real time by providing a secure way to voice and video call.
A platform for developing, managing and executing cyber security solutions.
is a platform that allows users to buy, sell, and trade gift cards for a small fee.
A platform for people with rare diseases to find research partners, and for researchers to find potential partners.
This platform is meant to help people collect and manage information about their health.

Groceries are a necessity for many people, but the process is often expensive and frustrating. The startup wants to simplify the process of ordering groceries and delivery by offering a concierge service and integrated ordering platform on their website.
A review platform for restaurants. Users can rate restaurants on their service, experience, and food quality.
A platform that connects consumers with products and services they want to buy directly from a mobile phone.
An online platform that asks you to rate products and services before you buy them, allowing you to compare them on the same scale as Amazon or Consumer Reports.
A “social network for influencers”, a platform for those who have large social media followings to connect with brands and offer free content.
A crowdfunding platform specifically for beginner producers and small businesses.

A micro-funding platform for entrepreneurs, reducing the cost of startup capital for high growth startups by providing a mechanism for investors to match their own funds with the startups they care about. The goal is to save startups money on the front end while generating real returns on the back end.
An online platform for managing B2B relationships, today the company provides a dashboard for sales and marketing teams to manage customer relationships.
A platform that helps brands track social media conversation and measure the effects of social media campaigns. The company is working with brands like Macy’s, Next, and Starbucks.
A startup that offers a highly customisable, easy-to-use platform for designing employee relocation packages
A platform that connects hungry customers with nearby restaurants to help them find the closest places to eat.
A social network for people who want to broker deals online, offering a place to advertise, find buyers, and find sellers on the platform.
A platform for organizing and sharing events, with a mobile app and desktop version.
A platform for HR to contribute to a company’s culture.
A platform that connects people to community service projects near them, with a web-based platform and mobile app.
A platform that allows employers to test job applicants with automated interviews and then quickly and easily assign the best candidates to the jobs.
A platform for keeping an eye on police in your neighborhood. The technology does not yet exist, but the startup is looking to build it and get it to market.
A company that allows companies to file taxes by way of an app. The startup is building a platform that automates the process of filling out tax forms.
A platform that’s like a meal-kit delivery service but for restaurants with a focus on healthy food. It’s a big market that’s hard to crack.
An automation platform that helps businesses manage the manual steps involved in order fulfillment, from tracking and managing inventory to automating how orders are processed.
A platform that allows users to create digital, social, and physical products by sending messages to a group of people in a bid to crowdsource their ideas or get feedback.

This startup is building an artificial intelligence-based platform for hiring, where customers can create a job description and AI will do the background check, find the best candidate, and schedule an interview.
A platform for fashion creators to build and sell their own fashion lines online.
A student loans platform, which has 4 million users
A platform that makes it easy for restaurants to streamline the food order process for both customers and their back-of-house staff.
A platform that enables online retailers to offer their customers the option to create their own exclusive in-store experiences.
A platform that allows both consumer and business users to collect and share data about their lives with the goal of helping them improve their health and save money.
A platform that lets people customize and sell their own tickets to events, with the potential to give artists more control over their work.
A platform that allows users to create and manage their own “user experiences” on a number of websites. People can make their own websites and online content, and get paid to do so.
A platform for buying and selling used cars, with a focus on selling cars without a title or dings.
A platform that will use AI to manage your data and help you solve problems.
A marketing platform for small businesses looking to leverage social media and e-mail marketing to build their brand and drive ROI.
A platform for building e-commerce sites from a set of drag-and-drop blocks.

The company is building a platform to help startups connect with investors and build a community of backers. The startup is working with Y Combinator and other investors to get more startups to pitch at YC.

A platform that allows users to share their thoughts, photos, and videos with each other. The idea is that this platform will help users share their experiences with each other in a more sharing-oriented way than Facebook.
A company that builds an online platform for users to create business cards with their company's name and logo.
A platform for selling and buying products on a curated, personal online marketplace.

An AI platform that helps companies evaluate their employees. The startup wants to help companies figure out what skills are most important for their companies and the best places to put those employees, building a more efficient workforce.
Idea: An on-demand therapy platform for people suffering from mental health issues
A startup that provides a gamified platform to help businesses understand and improve products and services to their customers. The startup sees itself as a kind of “Twilio for data”.
A web-based platform that provides users with a way to digitally record and collect feedback from their customers.
A platform that connects people looking to travel with people looking for people to do things while traveling.
A new, blockchain-enabled peer-to-peer lending platform that is targeting the global student debt crisis. The company is expanding internationally and looking for investors.
A real estate software company for agents. The startup develops a platform for agents to book appointments, send out listings, and manage client relationships.
This startup is developing a platform for smart contracts that automatically execute when specified conditions are met.
A startup that wants to make the web more social and connect people. The company is building an ad-free platform to give users more control over how they use the web.
A platform that helps companies transfer money to individual employees in different locations. It’s a way for companies to have more control over the money they spend and track where it goes.
A freelance platform where contractors can build websites, mobile apps, and other digital products.

A platform for sharing and selling reusable office supplies to businesses. The startup focuses on 8 great office supply items that are used a lot, but don’t get recycled as often as they should. They’re currently focusing on the US, but plan to expand internationally and into business software.
An online video platform for learning film making and production

This startup is building a platform to help people get money from friends and family. The company uses a paper check system that’s more commonly used in developing countries, and it plans to roll it out in the US, Canada, and Europe. They recently raised $1.5M in a seed round.
A digital platform where people can buy and sell cars and vehicles.

A rewards platform that lets people earn points for doing things with their phones, like taking a photo, following accounts and businesses, and more. Bunch can be redeemed for cash, merchandise, or travel.
“The first language learning platform”
A platform that uses machine learning to help people manage their finances. It currently has a team of 28 people.
A platform that helps lower the barrier for students and schools to create and share their own content.
A b2b cloud-based platform for building and managing customer relationships, helping businesses to better interact with their customers and increase customer loyalty.

A startup that helps small businesses with their insurance needs. The startup is built on the backbone of a large insurance company and offers an online platform to protect small businesses from cyber risks and cyber thefts.
A platform for “radical transparency”.
A software platform that lets brands communicate with marketing departments around the world — making workflows easier and more cost-effective.

This startup is building a platform for American farmers to sell their goods to consumers worldwide. The startup aims to use a mix of digital store fronts and technology to deliver to consumers in countries like India and China, where the rural population has been growing.
A platform for helping students better understand college loans, with an interactive quiz that helps students create a personalized repayment plan.
A platform for engaging in adventure activities with your friends and family.
A company that provides a platform that connects physical retail locations and other businesses like cashiers, janitors, and other support staff.
A platform for the creation of community-driven training videos.
A startup building a software platform for retail that automates product returns, credit, and refunds on all e-commerce sites
A platform that enables local retailers to accept payments from shoppers using mobile phones.
A free web-based platform for creating and sharing 3D models of objects.
A platform to help people discover new entertainment content in their area.
A real estate platform for small and medium sized businesses (SMBs) to buy and sell real estate.
A platform for lenders to offer loans backed by real estate.

A startup that makes the process of filling out Medicare Part D plans less painful. The platform helps people fill out their plans online, and acts as a sort of health insurance broker for people seeking Medicare coverage. The startup says their customers save an average of $50 per month.

A startup that is building a platform for onboarding new talent at small- and medium-sized businesses. The startup looks to make the hiring process much easier and more efficient by connecting employers with freelancers via an online marketplace.
Idea: A digital identity platform that allows people to prove who they are to anyone with a linked mobile phone number The startup claims they can onboard a new user within minutes
A cloud-based platform that helps small to mid-sized organizations with their e-commerce operations.
The company is building a platform for people to create and share videos of what they're building. The company's founder says that they've already sold their first video to a client.
A web-based platform for financial advisors to manage clients
An online platform for hiring and managing temps. The company wants to be the platform that bring together the world of temp agencies and temps to make it easier for employers and employees.
A platform for people to share, compare and book air travel with friend and family,

A new way to crowdsource ideas for new products, with the goal of helping fledgling startups get ideas for new products off the ground. The startup is building a platform for companies to crowdsource ideas in exchange for equity.
A startup that aims to help parents get their kid’s homework done. The company builds a platform for teachers to provide online computing to students via web-based apps.
A platform for quick and easy project management for small businesses, including software, creative, and other services.
This is a platform that provides software tools for IT teams to manage security and manage software deployments.
A platform that allows anyone to create a community for people who want to develop a product and generate revenue from it.

The company is building a platform that will allow people to land on a page with a listing of homes for sale, to create a profile, and then receive a personalized email to show homes that match their preferences.
A platform for employers to track employee schedules and timesheets, and pay employees on time and as agreed. It’s currently a text-message-based scheduling system.
A startup that is looking to build a new type of gaming platform that will provide a more social experience for gamers.

Using machine learning, Connect is building a platform that sorts through the clutter of online dating platforms to find the best match. The startup is currently in the process of raising its Series A.
A healthcare platform that rewards doctors for helping patients and generating revenue for the practice.
A platform for managing all your medical records and scheduling appointments, proposed as the Uber of healthcare.
A healthcare database platform that allows doctors to communicate with each other and share patient data.
A digital health care platform that helps patients track their medications.
An AI-powered solution for the construction industry. It’s a predictive maintenance platform that helps maintenance staff fix machines before they break down.
A platform for restaurants to offer delivery and delivery drivers to order delivery items.
A startup that is building a platform to help the two billion people in the world who don't have access to the Internet or smartphones.
A digital health and fitness platform for Indian families.
A platform that allows designers to sell their work without having to learn code

A platform that connects employees to various services via mobile apps and an API. The startup is building out a platform that lets companies grant permission to employees to use their mobile devices to access services and apps.
A digital business platform for companies that make and sell products, such as vending machines, vending machines, and more.
A music production platform for bedroom musicians. The startup is currently in YC’s Winter ’18 batch.
A platform for sharing and monetizing video. The startup’s goal is to apply the videos of YouTube stars to the video game and movie industries.

A tool that allows users to quickly find a doctor and schedule a visit from their mobile device. The startup’s website is now a platform for thousands of doctors in the US to set appointments on a first-come first-serve basis.
A software-as-a-service platform for realtors, allowing them to manage and sell their listings online.
An enterprise SaaS solution for companies that need a platform to handle all of the different aspects of running a business.

Fetch is a platform for food delivery. Unlike Grubhub, Fetch offers more than just food delivery. The startup is using the same data it collects on its deliveries to help restaurants build better menus and make food-ordering easier.
A platform for managing connected devices in the home, that connects devices to a single hub.
A web-based platform for building web apps.

A “Facebook for Real Estate” that combines a platform for real estate agents and sellers to find buyers and sellers with a native advertising platform (similar to Rent.com) that lets companies manage their presence on the site.
A platform that connects buyers with sellers, allowing users to sell used items like books and DVDs, or purchase new ones in bulk.
A data science platform that helps companies derive insights from data they already have.
A platform to help startups find a better audience for their product, through reviews, testimonials, and social proof and support.
An online video platform for conference speakers to share their expertise.

A platform to help companies control and manage their entire supply chain. The company wants to aggregate data on every step in the supply chain, create a comprehensive map of it and manage it all from a single dashboard.
A platform that lets you send money to friends in the Philippines, India, or China, in real time.
This startup is building a platform that lets anyone customize a pair of shoes for any use, whether it be running a marathon, doing yoga, or just trying to look cool.
A platform for managing micro loans for rural households.
A platform where you can sell your used stuff to others.
Builds custom, mobile-optimized, marketing platforms for B2B startups.

A platform that aims to be the Uber of errand work. The idea is that an employee can tap into the service using a smartphone, and then an app will ping them for errands that will help them get stuff done.
A digital platform for artists to share their work, get feedback, and start selling to gallery owners.

The startup is building a platform to help people to buy and sell gently used items, like cars, without having to go through a third party like eBay or Craigslist. They have a plan in place to expand into new categories in 2020.
An ecommerce platform for the Chinese market, allowing customers to purchase items online without leaving home.
A global marketplace for travel-related purchases with an app and an online platform.
A SaaS platform for companies to manage their social media accounts across Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, Twitter, and YouTube.
A video platform for independent artists to record online, edit videos together in real-time, and share with their fans.
A platform that suggests tech tools for specific jobs.
A platform that lets you see if you can save money on your next car purchase.
A digital media distribution platform for emerging musicians
An investment platform for early stage startups composed of a distributed network of partners who provide seed funding and advice.
A platform for people to buy and sell cryptocurrency. It’s not a brokerage, more of a marketplace for buyers and sellers to trade crypto.
A credit card payment platform that lets merchants accept credit cards on a physical retail location, without the risk of that location failing to pay the merchant.

Idea: A platform for making, distributing and monetizing augmented reality (AR) and virtual reality (VR) games The company says it’s already built over a dozen AR and VR games and is currently monetizing them through app stores, advertising, premium content, and in-app purchases
A platform for food delivery that wants to compete with GrubHub and Uber Eats.
An email marketing platform that sends emails based on what needs to be done.
An API that allows buyers to purchase products on Amazon, Walmart and other e-commerce platforms all in a single place.
A startup that is building a platform for training teachers in the US public school system. The startup wants to make school more attractive and profitable.
The company is building software that allows developers to use a single API to make apps for different platforms.
A startup that is creating a platform that allows companies to offer new employees a new kind of stock.
A platform that helps people find the right “egg donor” to help them have a child.
A startup that helps people on crowd-funding platforms avoid scammers
A platform for people to learn their own personal finance. The startup uses gamification to teach users about their finances and to promote financial literacy.
A digital education platform for low-income students, helping them understand their financial aid eligibility.
A platform that helps vendors find distributors that can offer them a better deal.

A platform where people can ask questions to experts, and get answers and advice. The idea is that millions of people can use it to get help with anything from career advice to questions about their own health.
A startup that provides a platform for students to connect with academic coaches online
A platform for remote workers, offering all the perks of a traditional office, including lounge space and good coffee, and many more.
A platform that lets people sell their WiFi network for a monthly fee.
A platform for sending and receiving money within the United States
A text-based messaging platform that serves as a go-to for employees and students to communicate with their employers and schools.
A platform designed for individuals and small businesses that helps them manage their finances.
A platform to help brands brand pro athletes
A platform that connects people looking to buy and sell goods and services for a commission. It’s similar to Groupon, but focused on more niche products and services.
A platform for buying and selling tickets to sporting events, concerts, and other live entertainment.
“An online platform that provides the opportunity to discover and hire top talent from around the world. They are already generating $4 million in annual revenue with a team of 8.”
This company is building a platform to allow users to buy and sell their “real-estate” on the blockchain.
A platform to help the world’s refugees find homes. It’s currently in beta.
A review platform that rates and ranks doctors.
This is an online course platform for language learners. The startup is starting with Spanish, and is planning to expand to Italian and French.
A software platform that helps human resources departments manage their employees' healthcare.
An online platform that helps students get into college by providing information about scholarships, programs and financial aid.
A new company to help people make connections in a city, using a “social media platform for the community”
A company that helps companies with sales and marketing by giving them a single source to track all of their leads on a single platform.
A platform that helps users build their own online courses, with the startup already building a library of courses for Udemy.
A startup that helps users find and connect with events near them. Since launching in May, the startup has seen over 2,000 new users join their platform.
A video-sharing platform that allows users to create their own videos, share them and get paid for them. The site is currently available in the UK and Australia and has more than 1 million users.
A tech-focused project management platform for small to midsize teams.
A “social beauty community” platform.
A platform for creative people to collaborate, post, and publish designs, images, and video.
A “pay as you feel” charity platform

This startup’s goal is to prevent ad fraud. It uses a combination of machine learning, data mining, and crowdsourcing to help companies like Amazon and Google detect fraudulent activity on their platforms.
A company that makes it easier to create, manage, and scale sales data. The platform is designed for sales teams to collect data about their clients, and make it available to others in the company.
This startup wants to help the international diplomatic community solve some of the most pressing problems by building an online platform for them to share their expertise.

Wheelchair-mounted fans to cool you down while you’re sitting in a wheelchair. The startup is among the first contestants into a new category for Kickstarter called “Mobility” that the company says is meant to help bring people who wouldn’t otherwise be able to take part in crowdfunding to the platform.
A platform for small businesses to publish, organize, and send their blog posts directly to their subscribers’ inboxes.
An online learning platform for students, whose teachers are given a stipend based on student enrollment.
A platform that helps digital nomads find their next destination to live and work online.
A platform that allows people who have low credit scores to apply for microloans
A B2B platform for local businesses that helps them find and choose the right contractors for the job.
A web-based platform that connects people who want to move furniture to those who want to buy it
A platform that lets you create and share holograms. The startup aims to “let you share, collaborate and create in 3D”.
A platform for social media managers to track and measure influencer engagement, traffic and sales.

"Authentic" is the name of an app that provides a secure, private and audited chat platform for businesses. The app allows users to create a private chat room for a group of up to ten people, with a group administrator who can add new members, delete or block members and monitor chat content. The company was founded by former Googler and Google Ventures partner Misha Chellam.
A platform that lets you create and sell custom-branded merchandise to your customers all in one place.
This startup is building a platform to help people pay their rent using cryptocurrency.
A tool that lets people manage their social media accounts on one platform.
A SaaS platform that helps companies with how to sell to the government.
A B2B platform company that helps healthcare and insurance companies gather and use patient data to improve care, manage costs, and reduce waste.
A digital marketing platform that makes it easier to find, think about, and plan content for your business.
A B2B platform that allows restaurants to print their own takeout menus.

A platform that helps businesses and job seekers find and connect with remote teams. Currently, they're working with a company in Brooklyn called Crave that hires people remotely through a third-party site.
A platform to help sales people connect with business partners in real-time. The startup helps sales reps and business partners connect using Facebook Messenger.
A digital platform for the home, with an API to help developers build apps and integrate with smart home devices.
A platform for travel and wellness.
A platform to allow landlords to manage their rental units and see the occupancy.
A platform for managing and sharing your home’s interior design.
An online platform where customers can review products they’ve purchased and engage with brands.

A startup for people who are trying to get out of their current jobs. It’s a platform for employees to apply for jobs in the company’s network, and even offer their own services to employers who hire them.
A platform for people to register for events and discover events as they are happening
A payment platform with built-in security safeguards.
A SaaS platform for job boards that connects job boards to job seekers, with an API for employers to use. The startup is looking to raise a maximum of $1.9 million from angel investors.
A web-based platform for building and testing APIs meant to be easy to deploy on multiple platforms.
A platform where people can pay with their debit and credit cards to buy products from merchants.
A platform for lawyers to offer legal advice to small businesses, and help them with various legal issues.
A platform for communicating with your doctor and getting answers to your health questions.

A platform that allows users to easily build online courses without writing code or creating webpages or videos. The company says it has 15,000 customers, including Udemy, Coursera, and Lynda.com, and has raised $1.5M.
An online platform connecting marketers with the right influencers for their campaigns.
A platform for influencers to receive feedback from their followers, so they can use it to become better at what they do.
A platform for helping the developing world manage the increasingly important issue of climate change.
A SaaS developer platform that helps teams develop better software using tools like code reviews, design reviews, and prototyping
A platform for companies to rent out unused office space when they don’t need it, for instance during a conference.
A platform that helps small business owners and startups collaborate on marketing strategy and execute their marketing campaigns with greater efficiency.
A platform for linking and managing your personal and professional social networks.
A platform where people can create a profile and upload photos of themselves to be rated by other users. The site is mostly for fun at this point, but it could be a useful tool for dating.
A startup is building a platform to organize and share photos and video of food. They’re already organizing the food into a public database.
“The most amazing platform to share your photos and videos.”

A SaaS company that offers a platform for managing employee benefits. It provides a software dashboard for insurance providers to compare health plans and find the best benefits to offer without having to communicate directly with consumers.
A platform that provides news content on social media sites
A secure messaging platform for work email
A web-based platform that helps you start and manage your own investment fund

A platform for product managers and engineers to collaborate on building software products, with a focus on helping teams at big companies get things built quickly and iterate rapidly. They charge a percentage of monthly revenue.

A company that builds the “Airbnb for internships”, connecting students with companies looking for summer interns. It’s a platform that allows both internships to be created and offers a marketplace for applications.
A company that helps businesses adopt a Salesforce-like platform designed to help them sell more efficiently.
A social media platform that brings brand power to the local community. It works by giving brands a platform on which they can interact with consumers and promote their products.
A company that is building an HR platform that connects employers and workers to make the hiring and onboarding process smoother and less error-prone.
A platform for brands and retailers to sell products from other stores in their network.
A platform for medical transcriptionists to get paid for their services, which are in high demand but difficult to find.
A security startup that’s building a platform to automatically detect and prevent fraud in the payments industry.
A platform that helps businesses manage their data more effectively, as well as connect diverse data sources.
A real-time customer service chat platform.

A startup prototyping a platform for helping companies recruit non-employees without having to pay to recruit a job applicant, which would be a win for the applicant and the company. (This is similar to the above Idea.)
A company that offers a platform for delivery of medical supplies to remote and underserved communities.
A platform that brings the benefits of crowdfunding to the traditional credit card industry.
This startup is building a platform intended to help e-commerce companies manage their inventory across different channels.
A software platform that helps connect retailers with ecommerce platform designers and developers.
A startup that creates a platform for people to get together and work out by doing things like hiking, biking, etc
A platform for employers to manage their recruiting needs without having to use their own infrastructure. It currently has 35 customers.

A startup that is working on a location-based ad platform. Their pitch is that they are the only ones building a smart ad stack that works across all channels, including the web, apps, and the physical world.
A platform for managing and operating autonomous vehicles without the need for a driver to be on board.
A startup that’s building a 3D printing platform for mixed-use buildings. The tech allows for 3D printing of 3D models to be used in building construction.
A digital platform for managing and monitoring medical and health records in the developing world.

They are looking to introduce a marketplace of sorts that allows companies to post and search for the service of a specific individual. They are also looking to launch a marketplace-style app for freelancers and clients to find each other.
A platform that allows people to create new kinds of jobs. Sift is building a “decentralized job market” with a system for workers and employers to set their own wages and terms.
A platform that helps small businesses find pet-friendly locations and protect against data breaches.
A platform that connects people to travel agents, booking flights, hotels, and car rentals. It’s building a tour-planning tool that’s similar to Google’s Allo.
A “B2B SaaS software platform for B2B marketers”.
A platform that aims to solve the problem of small businesses having to create multiple email accounts for each new customer in order to reduce the risk of email spam.

A platform that connects businesses with data science resources in a way that makes it easy to collaborate and get work done. The company also plans to launch a consumer app that will allow customers to sign up for machine learning-based advice.
A B2B software platform (for the legal industry) for small businesses that helps them manage contracts and warranties, manage their legal teams, and access multiple legal systems.
A startup that is building an AI-driven customer service platform that automates phone support for tens of thousands of its customers.

A platform for pharmaceuticals that wants to be the Uber for drug distribution. Instead of having to find a distributor, the startup wants to connect patients directly with pharmacies that can provide them with medicines.
A platform for streamlining the process of managing rental properties, meant to save landlords money on things like insurance and repair work.
Polldaddy is an app that allows users to make polls, collect data, and share the results. It works with most social media and blogging platforms.
A platform for meeting planners and event organizers to book freelance talent for online event production.
A SaaS platform for audits and compliance for investors.
A platform for running and publishing community-driven events, such as hackathons and meetups.
A platform for enterprise scale, complex transactions on the blockchain.

A “Social Commerce Platform” that allows brands to tie social media to their sales. The startup wants to help brands take advantage of social media to interact with their customers and drive sales. It’s working with a number of brands including Lululemon, Gatorade, and, most recently, Kia.
Real Democracy is a platform for elections, designed to make voting more accessible while improving the quality of elections.
Wooji is building a cloud-based platform for pets that collects pet health and behavior data from sensors and analysis software.
A platform for programmatic advertising, helping buyers target ads at businesses based on their size, location, and other criteria.
This company wants to build an AI-powered data platform to provide businesses with the information they need to make better, more informed decisions.
A platform that allows users to create and manage event pages on Facebook and Instagram.
This startup is a real estate marketplace for owners to rent out their properties for short-term stays, like Airbnb. They have over 25,000 properties on their platform.
A SaaS platform for marketers and businesses to create their own digital ads for Facebook. The startup is in a third round of investment and will launch in the first half of 2020.
A platform for users to rate their favorite restaurants, and a business for restaurants to use to grow their customer base.
This startup is building a platform that allows students to collaborate on projects and write code across school systems, in the hopes of creating a more creative learning environment.
A platform that helps people manage their contact lists. The startup says it’s dealing with a half-billion contacts with 70% of the world still not connected.
A customer service platform that helps companies plan and run customer support operations.
Speaking of the “Ikea of finance”, this startup is building a digital platform that lets you build your own financial portfolios.
A company that is building a platform for managing “smart” cities. The company wants to create a tool that helps cities manage resources like energy, parking, and transportation.
This is a startup that wants to help people “build on top of the internet,” with a platform that enables anyone to publish products and content at scale.
A platform for people to connect on a more personal level than on social media. A more serious side hustle to try to make rent.
A platform that allows users to create and share a digital drawing, which can be used by other users to add to or edit.
A platform for small to medium size business owners to create a customized email marketing campaign that can be send to their customers.
A platform that helps improve the user experience of customer support and sales. The company wants to help companies make better use of the technology they have.
A digital platform that helps entrepreneurs find investors.
This startup is building an interactive platform for teachers, parents, and students to communicate and collaborate.

A startup that’s building out a platform to help users with recurring payments like subscriptions and digital products. The product helps people manage their recurring payments, and is already being used by 65,000 users with 30,000 active channels.
Notify is a data entry platform used by companies like Facebook, Slack, and Etsy. The startup is building an email-based alternative, so companies don’t have to rely on their help desk.
A data platform that helps detect, prevent, and mitigate fraud on all payments. It works with banks, Venmo, and Western Union.
Platform that helps you build your own personal brand, including a social network to help you make connections with others. The startup is taking the “personal brand” concept to a whole new level.
Provides an SaaS platform for financing and investing. The company is currently targeting small business owners in the US.
A platform that brings businesses together with other companies in similar industries for collaboration and support.
A platform for online video production that allows users to add audio, video, and text to their videos.
A delivery platform for restaurants that lets them track the progress of their orders and instantly communicate with customers.
A mobile payments product that allows shoppers to pay for items on any device that supports NFC. The startup is building a payment platform for apps and retailers, as well as a recharge service.
A way for people to rent out their spare bedrooms and living rooms on Airbnb, or even to create an entire home on the platform.
A platform that allows teams to create video content, which the company will distribute.
A digital platform that helps young professionals find a way of earning extra income while also spending time with their families.
A platform for small business owners to manage the paperwork needed to start a company.
A platform that allows patients to get medication through mail (mailorder)
A platform that helps colleges and universities manage their relationships with alumni who have given money.

A startup that wants to build a platform for managing and organizing your entire digital life. It’s a way to keep things organized on all your devices, including a “calendar of everything” that can be accessed from any device.
A platform for small businesses to manage marketing and sales, enabling them to make more profitable sales and grow their customer base.
A platform that connects brands with influencers for advertising, sponsored content, and social media campaigns.
This startup is working on a platform that helps app developers understand how users click, swipe, click, and tap on their apps.
A platform for managing the needs of small- and medium-sized businesses, such as hiring and managing.
A platform that shows you the cheapest electricity rates in your area, saving you money.
A platform for self-driving car manufacturers to build their own maps and run their own fleets
A cloud-based B2B platform that makes it easy for fashion retailers to manage their customer relationships with the brands they sell.

A platform with a web-based portal for doctors to access patient information, allowing them to talk to patients or patients’ families remotely through video conferencing, or call them into their office.
A platform for law enforcement to send crime alerts to the public

A SaaS platform that helps companies manage their expense reports. It starts with a monthly subscription and then allows the user to create expense reports that are editable and searchable, with the option to export.
An enterprise-level CRM platform for small businesses to manage their customer relationships.
Rebuild is a software company that’s building a platform to help cities rebuild after disasters. The startup is based in San Francisco and has raised $2 million.
A platform that allows businesses to grant employees access to multiple work tools and applications. It’s currently in beta.
An AI-driven platform that comes with a team of data scientists, software engineers, and designers, and which wants to help companies find talent in India.
A platform that connects local shops with brands looking for wholesale deals through a one-stop shop.
A SaaS platform that helps companies identify people who would be a fit for their teams, and then find and hire them.
A platform for connecting borrowers with investors, allowing for investments in anything from clothing and food to cars and real estate.
Cone.io is a SaaS platform that allows companies to build their own social media presence on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, YouTube, and Instagram.
A platform for designing and sharing potential learning paths. The startup is building a digital pedagogy tool and learning platform.
The startup is building a unique platform to allow students to take online classes that they can’t otherwise afford.

A platform for direct-to-consumer health care that allows users to share health data and receive treatment recommendations from a variety of doctors and hospitals. The company says it is the only platform of its kind and has raised $1.2 million to date.
A platform that helps people find apartments and buy houses, allowing them to compare prices, amenities, and neighborhood reviews.
“A platform that allows you to connect with professionals in your area,” as the pitch goes.

A crowdfunding platform that aims to help entrepreneurs pitch their projects on a more intimate level. It’s a tool to help founders speak directly to the crowd without the need for a large team of people. It’s currently in private beta.
This startup is building a B2B platform that connects freelancers and agencies with manufacturing manufacturers.
SaaS platform that helps employees get paid for being productive.
A platform that enables people to interact with their favorite brands through video. The startup’s founders say they have 40,000+ customers for the product.
The startup is creating a platform for individuals to buy and sell digital goods.
A business-to-business platform to order medical supplies.
A self-service platform for independent auto service shops.
A platform for selling products online, with a focus on fashion.
A commerce platform that allows small businesses to sell their wares and services directly to consumers online.
A platform for recording and sharing video, including the ability to store, search and share clips.
A startup that offers a platform for real-time problem solving called “Teamwork”
This startup wants to provide users with a platform to create personalized content across different platforms. The company describes it as a Snapchat for creative expressions.
A platform that helps you find the best trades for your portfolio by building a personalized trading algorithm. The startup gets its data from a network of more than 500,000 financial analysts.
This company is looking to build a platform that allows companies to license their software, and then bundle it with services like a data center, software development, or SaaS.
A customer service platform that lets customers ask questions about their accounts in a more accessible way.
The company’s first product is a way to manage your social media posts across multiple platforms like Facebook Twitter and LinkedIn.

For over two years, the company has been working on a platform that allows teams to track the sales process and view it as a movie, with data visualizations and a dynamic timeline. Users can pull data from any source, and the company’s been working with a number of clients, including the White House, to do this.
A platform for sharing and rating products across the web, where consumers can go to see what the top products in a category are and rate them.
A platform that helps brands build a mobile game, a video, a mobile app and a mobile website all from one tool.
Built on Python, Dropbox for Business is a collaboration and file sharing platform that works with Dropbox and Google Docs. The company was acquired by Dropbox in late 2018 for $100 million.

A startup that wants to compete with the likes of Yelp and Uber with a streamlined, all-in-one platform for restaurants and small businesses. It’s a one-stop shop for everything from customer scheduling, to sales and marketing, to communication between staff and owners.
A company building a platform for employers to offer flexible work arrangements to their employees. The company, which was launched in August, is already working with over 500 companies.
A platform for companies to sell and manage their employee vacation time, incentivizing employees to take it when they’re able.
Cofound.it is a platform for fundraising, with a $50 million fund to invest in startups. It has already distributed over $40 million to startups.
A platform that matches people looking for work with freelancers
A company that provides a platform for the ability to manage, track and process all of the data generated by the billions of sensors that are embedded in the world’s devices.
A digital insurance platform that allows consumers to manage insurance policies online.
This startup is building an AI-driven platform for finding freelance contractors, similar to Upwork or Freelancer. The startup has raised $4 million and is based in the UK.

A new platform that creates targeted ads using the data from your social media. It’s not clear how exactly this would work, but the startup is hoping to “dramatically change the way brands target customers”.

The company, which is based in Barcelona, is re-imagining how people can work remotely. It offers a cloud based software platform for the organization of remote teams and the ability to interact with coworkers on video.
An AI-powered HR platform that helps companies recruit and manage employees.
A platform to improve the quality of customer service and make your employees happier.
The startup recently raised $800,000 in seed funding, and has been using this to build a platform for people to tell stories and create video content in a “curated, structured, and safe environment”.

A global payments platform, SendFriend is a virtual bank account and payments platform that allows users to purchase goods and services without a bank account. It’s similar to TransferWise but with a focus on emerging markets.
A platform for visualizing the supply chain of products, especially food.
A software-as-a-service platform that helps people easily manage their credit and student loan accounts. The startup is also building a personal finance dashboard.
A platform for companies to create, manage and track software development jobs, with a free software development life cycle.
An enterprise application integration (EAI) platform for managing complex API integrations.
A platform that helps large businesses manage their supply chain, with a mobile app that lets users order and track products. It’s backed by Airbus and seen as a competitor to Shopify.
The startup pitches its platform as the “one-stop shop for all things HR”. It will offer HR software, payroll, and benefits management. It also recently raised $1.5M in seed funding.
A startup that develops a software platform for tracking and analyzing all the marketing campaigns that are out there.
A company that helps people make their own clothes, using a design platform that puts together collections of patterns, fabrics, and accessories.
